about: Welcome to Bova’s Bakery, we have the warm and tasty bakery foods people in the Boston, MA area have been dreaming about.
description:
Our bakery selection is colossal and every food is made with our family recipes that have been handed down for over 3 generations! We are most famous for our warm Italian bread/cookies, lobster tails, éclairs, Whoopie pies, subs, ricotta cannoli, creamy tiramisu, flakey turnovers, fresh fruit tarts, jumbo chocolate dipped strawberries, and Neapolitans.

In a rush? Take-out some of our calzones, Sicilian pizzas, or over-sized subs! 

You’ll find all kinds of people in here too. From students to construction workers, the good food helps them return. We keep the foods people love and constantly change up the menu to keep ourselves interesting. 

Shoot us an email on our website and keep up the conversation! Or just come by and taste/grab our sweet tastes of Italy!

about: A polished and playful venue celebrating Boston's rich and diverse history.
description:

We have two floors offering a wide range of event possibilities. We are conveniently situated on the cusp of the Financial District. 

The atmosphere at Bostonia is best described as sociably sophisticated. An ambiance that lends itself to both a polished dining experience and spirited bar environment. An attractive space for discerning urbanites and casual diners alike. A place where friends can socialize after work, anyone can pull up a stool and feel at home, and visitors come to revel in the ‘Boston experience’.

about: The Boston Public Market is an indoor, year-round marketplace offering fresh, seasonal, locally sourced food. Parking validation available for Parcel 7 Garage.
description:
The Boston Public Market is an indoor, year round marketplace for locally sourced groceries and specialty agricultural products, where residents and visitors can find fresh, seasonal, local food from Massachusetts and New England. The Market houses 40 local farmers, fishers, and food entrepreneurs selling items such as farm fresh produce; meat and poultry; eggs; milk and cheese; fish and shellfish; bread and baked goods; beverages; flowers; and
an assortment of specialty and prepared foods. Everything sold at the Market is produced or originates in New England.

Development of the Boston Public Market was a partnership between the not-for-profit Boston Public Market Association, individual and corporate donors, foundations, the City of Boston, and the project’s seed funder, the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. The Boston Public Market Association (a registered 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization) developed and operates the Boston Public Market with a public impact mission to support the farmers, fishers, and entrepreneurs who grow, catch and produce local food, and to nourish our community with food and experiences.
name: Boston Public Market

about: Welcome to Mr. Dooley's Boston Tavern You are "Dooley" invited in!
description:
Welcome to the iconic  Mr. Dooley's Boston Tavern, a "Great Place for A Pint, and a Chat"!

Nestled in the heart of the Financial District amongst the skyscrapers   and bustling businessmen and women below is the Haven known to many as “Dooleys”. Mr Dooleys Boston Tavern opened it’s doors in September 1991 and since then has become the benchmark for Authentic Irish Hospitality in not only Downtown Boston but nation wide.  Once you step into Mr. Dooley's, you are welcomed in with a friendly nod or smile from the courteous staff, the hustle and bustle of the city streets are left outside, and the spirit of the room warms the soul. 

Throughout the explosion of “Irish Theme Bars” which have popped up seemingly on every corner in Boston, Dooley's has stayed true to its tried and tested tradition of straight forward Irish Hospitality  - As one bartender put it “ If ye want a theme park go to Disney, if ye want a pint come to Dooley’s !”

Guests will find that the easygoing approach of the staff is no reflection to the high standard of quality in services provided in the pub. Indeed, Mr. Dooley’s has both a Award Winning full Lunch and Dinner Menu. Hailed by the Media, Dooley's has received "Best of Boston for Casual Dinning", “Boston’s Best Burgers”, and "Great Place for Cheap Eats". Our Traditional Irish Breakfast has given Dooley's Citywide acclaim and has drawn in such prominent figures as Bono from U2, the Kennedy Family, and many many more. Although, Dooley's Traditional Irish Breakfast has satisfied many the Influencer we aim to satisfy all who grace our doorstep.  As a tribute to New England, Mr Dooley’s also boasts an array of Seafood dishes including Award Winning New England Clam Chowder (Winner of Boston's Annual Chowerfest), fresh Oysters and Lobster.

Live entertainment can be heard 7 Nights a Week at Mr. Dooley's, the Cornerstone for Traditional Irish Music in Boston. Bands and musicians come direct from Ireland to play at Mr. Dooley's which bolsters the whole 'Dooley Experience' . But that’s not where it ends, any given moment an impromptu “Sessuin” can start up, as Mr. Dooleys is a favorite with many local musicians as well. However, the best form of entertainment can be the hilarious banter provided by our friendly Bartenders and Wait Staff!

So drop in and see Us at  Mr. Dooley's Boston Tavern 77 Broad Street! You may walk in a stranger, But You will be leaving as a lifelong Friend! As the "Dean of Irish Pubs" ,and founder of Mr. Dooley's, John Joe Somers would say "Trust Everyone, But You Cut the Cards"! Slainte!
name: Mr. Dooleys Boston Tavern

about: 'Headquarters Of The Revolution' ~Daniel Webster. Samuel Adams, Dr.Joseph Warren, & Paul Revere & Other notable Founding Fathers met at The Green Dragon.
description:
The Green Dragon Tavern has a long and rich history, playing an important part in the freedom of Boston during the War of Independence. Established in 1654 The Green Dragon was a favorite haunt of Paul Revere (who we consider a close neighbor) and John Hancock (whose brother lived next door!). Indeed, it has been ratified by the famous historian Daniel Webster that it was in The Green Dragon that the plans for the invasion of Lexington and Concord were overheard, thus starting the famous ride of Paul Revere.

Today The Green Dragon still plays host to a diverse and colorful clientele, though the practice of eavesdropping has long since stopped! With a full Lunch and Dinner Menu it is a popular eatery with visitors to Boston who enjoy dining in a working piece of History! With a full array of Irish-American fare and a wide choice of Traditional New England Seafood dishes The Green Dragon offers a choice for even the most discerning palate.

Even with its long and noble history The Green Dragon is still a vibrant and thriving nightspot and is a firm favorite with college students and young professionals. Indeed the Green Dragon embodies the essence that is Boston City – the delicate blend of rich history and vibrant youthfulness! With a selection of Top 40’s cover bands playing each Thursday through Sunday you are always guaranteed a buzzing night at The Green Dragon!
name: The Green Dragon

about: Not your average Italian establishment. "Wicked fresh. Crazy Good." is our motto and we mean it. Family owned and run for decades, providing take out and catering to the North End and Boston.
description:
I [Pauli] started working in the North End in my family’s food businesses when I was just eight years old. Back then, the North End was a neighborhood where everybody actually knew your name, and “freshness, quality and value” weren't just trendy catch phrases—they were simply expected.

Today, Pauli’s is based on that same philosophy. We believe you deserve food that’s always served wicked fresh, that always tastes crazy good and that doesn't cost a lot of money. At Pauli’s, you’ll find the comfort food you crave, the healthy options you want and the variety you need, all for an excellent value.

So come on in. We’d love to get to know you by name.

Follow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/PaulisBoston

about: Experience a warm and pleasant evening with culinary pleasures. Over 35 years of perfected authentic Italian cuisine. The hidden gem of the North End!
description:
From the time I can remember, while I was growing up in this Italian neighborhood, the North End of Boston, my grandmother, Crocefissa Barbara Summa, was a great influence in my life.

It was at her dinner table that I learned of friendship and love, and by her side I discovered the art of Italian cooking. I learned it all begins with the best ingredients to bring out the simplicity of flavors of Sicilian cuisine as well as the many various regions throughout Italy.

So, in 1983, when I opened my restaurant, it was a natural and loving choice to name it after my grandmother. At that time she was still with us and enjoyed coming here to help and converse with our guests. She would sit with pride in the small dining room and assist with minor chores while making sure our guests were properly served.

Today she is no longer at my side, but her love and spirit never ceases to guide me.

It pleases me that you selected to dine at La Summa. I know that your experience will be warm and pleasant, with culinary pleasures. 


Barbara Summa Sullivan
name: La Summa Cucina Italiana

about: Vinoteca di Monica, authentic Italian dishes and an award-winning wine list that adds a touch of contemporary to old world classics. North End, Boston
description:
Vinoteca di Monica offers our guests rustic Italian dishes and an award-winning wine list that adds a touch of contemporary to old world classics.

Located on the Freedom Trail, in the heart of the North End of Boston, Vinoteca di Monica is the result of its chef‘s passion for the Italian culture and the big role that food and wine plays in its preservation. Specializing in regional Italian cuisine, Chef Jorge Mendoza-Iturralde incorporates international techniques and ingredients to traditional recipes. The menu focuses on the preservation of regional dishes, with an unpretentious dedication to the true flavors that make Italian cuisine so popular. On a nightly basis, the menu at Vinoteca di Monica offers diners unmatched recipes of home-made pasta dishes, grilled meats, succulent New England seafoods, and preparation of locally farmed produce. 

The wine list reflects years of research and gathering, and wine selections range from regional varietals to selected vintages, with an emphasis on the true representation of each geographic region. To complement the different characteristics of the wines from the varied Italian regions, the culinary approach is simple with a dedication to preserving the cultural crafts that make it so special.

We look forward to sharing our family’s heritage and our Chef Mendoza-Iturralde’s expertise with you!
name: Vinoteca di Monica

about: Tavern in the Square North Station is located in the heart of downtown Boston, across the street from the TD Garden at 120 Beverly Street.
description:
Tavern in the Square North Station is located in the heart of downtown Boston, across the street from the TD Garden at 120 Beverly Street. We’re the best spot in the neighborhood—come see why!

Since opening in September 2014, Tavern in the Square North Station has been the go-to spot for Sunday football, Bruins, and Celtics games as well as other Boston Garden events. We have something for everyone on our menu. We offer outdoor patio season with a comfy lounge for when the weather is right, a bar area surrounded by TVs, and a dining room for a more intimate setting that’s still close to the action.

We offer 50 beers on tap, craft beer selections, seasonal cocktails with fresh ingredients, and food that you and your friends will talk about all week: house-crafted burgers, eggplant caprese, and ahi tuna poke! Be sure to come by for weekend brunch where we mix in classics such as Nutella French toast with fun inspired new favorites, such as our donut burger!

Centrally located and immediately adjacent to the MBTA’s orange, green and purple lines, our North Station location provides the perfect base camp for a fun day’s excursion into historic Boston or to have a quick bite and drink before catching your train home.
name: Tavern in the Square North Station

about: Filippo Ristorante located in Boston's historic North End proudly serves Italian cuisine with a strong focus from the Abruzzo region of Italy where the Frattaroli family hails from.
description:
The Frattaroli family have strongly influenced the bustling North End dining scene as one of the first family owned and continually operated authentic Italian restaurants. Filippo Frattaroli is a culinary pioneer who brought over his special recipes and passion for food from his hometown of Sulmona (Abruzzo) Italy. The dishes that you will find at Filippo's covers an extensive menu of fresh pastas, fish, meats and grains that are staples in Italian cuisine. 

Filippo's love of cooking and passion to share his talents with friends is evident with the many photos that adorn the restaurant walls. Former Presidents, dignitaries and celebrities have dined in what Filippo likes to call his "home". He has further expanded on his love of sharing food and traditions by creating a beautiful function facility where he personally will cook rustic dishes for any special occasion. 

It is the pleasure from the Frattaroli family to invite you to their "home" to indulge in flavors, tradition and good old fashion food.
name: Filippo Ristorante & Cafe

about: Carrie Nation is a restaurant and cocktail club on Beacon Hill, offering an eclectic mix of modern and turn of the century cuisine and cocktails.
description: Carrie Amelia Moore Nation (November 25, 1846 – June 9, 1911) was an American woman who was a radical member of the temperance movement, which opposed alcohol before the advent of Prohibition. She is particularly noteworthy for promoting her viewpoint through vandalism. Nation frequently attacked the property of alcohol-serving establishments (most often taverns) with a hatchet. Recently, Nation's behavior has inspired fiction writers as well as an opera composer. Nation was a relatively large woman, almost 6 feet (180 cm) tall and weighing 175 pounds (79 kg), with a stern countenance. She described herself as "a bulldog running along at the feet of Jesus, barking at what He doesn't like," and claimed a divine ordination to promote temperance by destroying bars.  In the spirit of fun and irony, Carrie Nation Cocktail club opened its doors under the same identity as the hatchet wielding prohibition advocate. Luckily for us, that was shortlived. As Boston's premiere cocktail club, we carry premium and local spirits while only using the freshest ingredients to prepare turn of the century classics, and to create fun and contemporary takes on those same classics.  All of our mixes, juices squeezed fresh daily in house and our homemade bitters demonstrate our commitment to craft cocktails and the art of mixology.  For a truly elegant and refined experience, please join us and see what the buzz is all about!
name: Carrie Nation Cocktail Club

about: West End Johnnie’s in Boston incorporates the melting pot of this historic West End area through its ambiance, people, and food.
description:
West End Johnnie’s serves American cuisine influenced by the rich cultures and heritage of Boston. The menu reaches back in time drawing influences from all of the groups who once lived here: African American, Irish, Jewish, Italian, and Eastern European communities.

Our delicious, homemade food spans the range from dishes like freshly made meatballs to 1919 grilled Molasses wings, sweet potato chips, house marinated steak tips, pan roasted salmon and more. West End Johnnie’s also has one of the best brunches in town every Sunday. Combine our cuisine with full bar service and great bartenders, and we’ve got something for everyone. 

Johnnie’s appeals to a wide spectrum of customers from sports fans, celebrities, politicians, families, and its West End neighbors. West End Johnnie’s: there’s absolutely nothing else like it in Boston!
name: West End Johnnies

about: Japanese coffee roaster & shop in Boston’s DTX. Experience our urban oasis for exceptional coffee, hospitality & latte art.
description: In 1952, Hidetsugu Ogawa started an independent coffee roasting business in Kyoto, Japan. That business evolved over the next 60 years into the Ogawa Coffee Co., Ltd., currently ranked among the top four coffee bean wholesalers in Japan. Still growing, today there are 36 Ogawa Coffee independently-owned and operated coffee shops throughout Japan and one international shop in Boston, Massachusetts. Ogawa Coffee baristas, known internationally for their exceptional hospitality, and honed skills including unique latte art, are some of the most talented in the world, with several world class baristas on staff.

description:

As its name implies, the Trattoria serves a delicious lunch with ample daily specials and a dinner menu that reflects home cooking. Chefs Frank and Patrick Mendoza have crafted a menu full of authentic dishes ranging from the classic Caprese salad to the Braciolettini di Vitello with its roasted veal to the pan-seared scallops found in the Fettuccine Nero con Caposante. Enjoy all this with a glass of wine in a cozy, candle-lit dining room featuring exposed brick walls and original family artwork for a casual elegance and welcoming atmosphere.

Join us soon at Trattoria di Monica for an excellent lunch, dinner, or drink with your family and friends!

about: American Brasserie in Downtown Crossing/Financial District. Lunch, dinner, late-nite, oyster bar, 36 drafts, craft cocktails, 2 private dining rooms and more.
description:
At The Merchant, we make almost all our fare from scratch.  The building itself is a big space that served for more than a century as a leather goods store. We've brought in high-top tables near the windows ... a 40-foot bar on one side of the room, and more formal dining spots on the opposite side. We have a semi-private dining room in back, and another dining room downstairs.

For our menu, we cure and smoke all the meat in house. Our burger is top-notch, as are other dishes like roast chicken, dayboat scallops and “rustic” desserts. The Merchant serves salads, sandwiches ($10-$15), and more for the lunch rush. And for dinner, we are a full-service brasserie (with most entrees ranging from $22-$26).

The bar has 36 beers on tap, many of them locally brewed, plus a full selection of craft cocktails to serve our patrons, especially the after-work crowd. Our raw bar is open from 11 am till closing, part of a late-night menu that is served each night(until midnight or 1am).
name: The Merchant

about: 17 beers on draft, daily food specials and a warm local atmosphere! Join us Sun-Tues for 10¢ wings! Wed-Thurs for half priced apps! Team Trivia Weds @ 9pm!
description:
For over 100 years, The Red Hat has been serving up the finest in food and beverages.  Originally, catering to sailors on leave, dockworkers and shipbuilders looking for an inexpensive place to eat, The Red Hat soon became a local favorite to businessmen on their lunch hour and ladies doing their shopping for the week.

Located in the heart of Scollay Square, an area once best known for its vaudeville theatre and world famous risqué entertainment, The Red Hat gained the reputation as a hotspot not to be missed while visiting the city. Because of that popularity, The Red Hat was even able to survive prohibition by maintaining the image of a reputable restaurant by day and a speakeasy by night.

After more than a century, The Red Hat is still showing the city's finest a good time.  We still serve up the finest food and beverages in the area.  We still cater to sailors on leave, dockworkers, shipbuilders, businessmen and ladies.  And, most of all we are still a hotspot not to be missed while visiting the city.
name: The Red Hat

about: Where Beacon Hill Meets    http://pinterest.com/21stamendment/  follow us on twitter @21amendment
description:
Boston is an enormously passionate city, spirited debate is practically our fifth major sport. While we may respectfully part ways on nearly everything, including that necktie of yours, public opinion is squarely behind the 21st Amendment.

The 21st has elevated the "neighborhood pub" concept high above Beacon Hill by infusing our spin on traditional pub classics while carving out our own culinary history. When both locals and visitors are seen rubbing, okay, bending elbows in the same room, it's obvious that the quality of the food and the company has transcended party lines. Come spend some time with us at the 21st and see where Beacon Hill Meets!

about: A Rustic-Modern American Restaurant/Bar
description:
Located at the end of Milk Street, the newest addition to the Glynn Hospitality Group portfolio of restaurants and iconic hotspots is certain to impress. Making its home in the Charles Bulfinch designed building constructed in 1816, this 250 seat restaurant will boast two floors, two bars, exposed kitchen, patio, and panoramic al fresco style windows. 

The concept, design, décor and menu and are all intended to be expressions of simplicity executed to perfection. Designer Kelly Laurence describes her latest innovation as, “…a place where rustic and modern elements meld seamlessly to create a casually-stylish environment.” She adds, “Historic granite blocks, exposed brick, massive wooden beams complemented by contemporary touches…creates a bright, inviting and character-filled space for tourists, families and traditionalist Bostonians alike. 

The informal and welcoming atmosphere is reaffirmed with the gastronomic offerings.  Locavore’s will relish the fact there is an emphasis on Slow Food principles, fresh seafood, farmer’s market produce and dynamic presentations. There is a focus on healthy preparations and locally sourced ingredients; simple comfort food concepts enhanced by unique accompaniments. The menu will be relatively small in size (no more than 25-30 items), with a spotlight on charcuterie, regional shellfish, flatbreads, and New England classics with a twist.

The Granary Tavern is open daily for lunch, dinner, after work crowds, dining, late night snacking and a great place to meet for cocktails and conversation. Brunch is also offered on Saturdays and Sundays.
name: Granary Tavern

about: A Boston Classic for Food and Fun
description:
Across the street from the storied Boston Garden, the Harp has been serving up food, fun and entertainment for nearly twenty years. A local favorite for generations of sports fanatics and thrill seekers, the Harp is North Station's best location for cutting edge nightlife and pre and post game celebrations. All the latest in sports, games, and sports-related news on 20 TVs surrounding three bars plus our giant projection screen assures you of catching all your favorite sports day and night.

Featuring live entertainment, DJs, dancing and nightlife every Friday and Saturday night, The Harp books the best bands from across New England, New York, Philadelphia, and along the East Coast. DJs spin two floors with three bars of high-energy entertainment.

Loyal fans to our Boston and New England teams: Celtics, Bruins, Red Sox, and Patriots, the Harp is the premier pre and post Garden event hub for meeting, drinking, and eating.

about: Bostons 1st Irish "Super Pub" arrived on the scene January 28th, '05 in the form of Paddy O's. Choice venue for live music & DJs, sports, fare & libations!
description:
Bostons first Irish "Super Pub" arrived on the scene January 28th, 2005 in the form of Paddy O's. This latest offering from the Somers Pubs embodies everything that is Boston-Irish and Ireland. From the hand-crafted bar to the authentic Furniture, custom made in Ireland, this pub breathes "one hundred thousand Welcomes" from the moment you step through the Door. But this is not the home of Saints and Scholars or Mythical Creatures. Paddy O's has just one purpose in mind FUN!

"Nobody knows how to enjoy themselves like the Irish" quips John Joe Somers, the driving force behind this bar's creation. John Joe is proud to be from a nation renowned for spreading fun and good times throughout Boston & the planet really!  He is "doing his bit for the true Irish heritage". The Pub boasts all the traits of a good Irish local, complete with cozy snugs, natural stone pillars and a full stage which caters for everything from live acoustic sessions through to Boston's hottest Top 40 & Rock Bands and resident DJ. Paddy O's is a premier venue to watch all sporting events.  Surrounded by HDTVs and 2 massive HD screens, a fully equipped DJ booth and state of the art sound system, there isn't a bad seat in the house!

Paddy O's offers a menu full of choice Irish fare with an emphasis on old classics & nouveau pub fare.  So, whatever your pleasure and what ever your measure, drop into Paddy O's any night of the week!, at 33 Union Street , in the Faneuil Hall district, and you won't leave disappointed!
name: Paddy O's Boston

In June of 2005, inspired by their mother’s and grandmother’s classic Italian recipes as well as their travels through Italy, Chef/owners Carla Pallotta & Christine Pallotta decided to open Nebo Cucina & Enoteca in their childhood neighborhood of Boston’s North End. Nebo Cucina’s 520 Atlantic Avenue on Boston’s Waterfront offers a menu which captures the true essence of dining in an Italian home.
Nebo’s industrial decor honors their old world Italian neighborhood with original structural beams, brick vaulted ceilings, Venetian plaster walls and marble counter tops . Sit at one of our 75 outdoor patio seats and experience a true Italian lifestyle. Enjoy house made bread, rustic Italian dishes and a variety of pizza and drink any of the 100 Italian wines or unique cocktails while surrounded by a view of Boston’s beautiful skyline and the Rose Kennedy Greenway.

about: The Best Seafood Restaurant in Faneul Hall - Boston MA
description:
Come visit us today. We are a distinguished seafood restaurant/store and we bring to you an incredible menu featuring the fresh caught Maine Steamed Lobster and the delicious award-winning New England Clam Chowder.
If you are a seafood aficionado, come treat yourself to our variety of delicacies including steamer clams, mussels, oysters and shrimp.
You will absolutely love our fresh fish fillets such as salmon, scrod, sword fish and our kebobs and scallops wrapped in bacon.
And if you don't know where to start, I'd be happy to suggest our mouth-watering best seller: the popular Lobster Roll Special, a fresh made lobster roll sandwich with a cup of our hearty made-from-scratch clam chowder.
Boston and Maine Fish Co. has been in business since 1984 and we are located inside the Quincy Market building in Faneuil Hall market place, Boston MA, one of the most famous places in the country attracting millions of people annually from around the world.
Come and take part of this great experience where you can enjoy your delicious meal as you walk through the fabulous Quincy Market, or you can seat and relax at our bar having your cold beer or wine.

about: The best Mexican food in Boston is a hidden gem. Come for the original grilled burritos and more!
description:
https://www.facebook.com/villamexicocafe
https://www.twitter.com/villamexicocafe
https://www.instagram.com/villamexicocafe
Snapchat: villamexicocafe

Villa México Café had its origins in Woburn, Mass. Julie King, owner, manager, cook, cleaner and everything else, moved there with her daughter, Bessie, after her American husband passed away from Alzheimer's. A lawyer in Mexico, Julie could not litigate in Massachusetts without going to school again. However, at that time her daughter's education came before hers. She therefore decided to open a restaurant since she found no good Mexican food in Woburn or its surroundings, or authentic Mexican food for that matter. She went into business with one purpose only: to bring authentic, homemade Mexican food to the people of New England. 

The first two Villa México Café locations were in Woburn. In 2006 Julie relocated to a gas station store in Beacon Hill. The last gas station in Boston became the notorious home of the "gas station burritos," and at that spot the restaurant earned its "Best Burrito in Boston" title from Boston Phoenix and Improper Bostonian. 

The gas station was demolished for redevelopment in 2013 and the latest Villa México Café opened in Boston's Financial District on January 11, 2016. During this period the business continued its black salsa sales and catering. Now, still serving authentic Mexican dishes like burritos, quesadillas, tacos, tostadas, fresh fruit waters and more, Villa México Café continues with its mission. To the like (or dislike) of customers, Julie and Bessie say that if they don't eat it in Mexico they won't sell it. 

Julie has come to be known as Momma King, nurturing customers as friends. To her and to the team the restaurant is not just a business, it is a home and a safe zone; welcoming everyone to eat, to learn, to talk and to make our city better together.  As Momma King says, "Hi my friends! Welcome to our 'changarro!'"
name: Villa Mexico Cafe

about: Sterling's initial allure is its impressive atmosphere, the upscale eatery's "it" factor is thanks to a trifecta of stand-out elements that includes equally appealing masterfully crafted cocktails and creative comfort cuisine.
description:
Situated on the main floor of the 60 State Street building, Sterling’s has a crafted cocktail-centric concept that has been described as having a classically hip ambiance with refined swagger. With nothing comparable in the local scene, the venue attracts the well-heeled and professional clientele in the building, while the vast patio overlooking Faneuil Hall is just as appealing to those in flip-flops and t-shirts. Regardless of the seat you grab, genuine hospitality is always what you receive!

Stately men’s clothing and styles circa 1960′s provided inspiration for the design concept. Tufted banquets, patina tin ceilings, herringbone tiles, and chestnut wood statements are finishing touches that impart class, comfort, elegance and a sense of sophistication.

Paying homage to the classics, simplicity is an integral part of the beverage offerings. “Shaken, stirred, or muddled” is the spirited mantra of the bartenders at Sterling’s.

The Retro-American themed menu aims to be holistic, yet mindful of the crowds that flood Faneuil Hall. “Urbane and peppered with all the things Julia Child!”
name: Sterling's

description: Grainmaker began with the simple belief that food can change lives for the better. Inspired by a journey through Southeast Asia, we combined the diverse flavors of street food with the region’s most essential ingredient: the humble grain. Every meal we serve embraces the deeply rooted connection between man (and woman) and nature through organic grains, locally-sourced produce whenever possible, and humanely-raised meats, prepared fresh every day. The greatest movements begin with one small seed, and we’re growing ours into a thriving community every day.

about: Fóumami (“Foo-mah-mee”) is an inventive Asian sandwich bar serving breakfast & lunch, to stay or to go.
description:
To learn more about franchising opportunities with Fóumami, please visit www.foumamifranchise.com

Fóumami (pronounced "Foo-mah-mee"), a fast casual Asian restaurant concept, is an inventive Asian sandwich bar serving breakfast, lunch and dinner options - Asian-inspired sandwiches, salads, soups and beverages - to stay or to go. Family recipes and traditional flavors from China, Japan and Korea provide the foundation on which Fóumami designs its signature dishes, most notably of which are its sandwiches served on hand-made freshly baked Shao Bing (a Chinese flatbread) unleavened bread that is crisp and flaky on the outside, yet soft and chewy on the inside.

Established and headquartered in Boston, MA in 2010, Fóumami - brainchild of Michael Wang, a 3rd generation restaurateur and Harvard MBA - opened its doors to the public in the summer of 2010 on July 20th in the heart of Boston's bustling Financial District. While building Fóumami certainly has been a labor of love for Michael, he’s always brought an analytical eye to the process, and a vision for Fóumami as a franchising opportunity and a national brand.  Michael held back on expansion for a number of years in order to prove the concept and work through every aspect of our business.

Fóumami has recently entered the franchising arena. We are uniquely positioned to capitalize on Asian food’s status as the fastest growing segment in the fast casual category.

To learn more about franchising opportunities with Fóumami, please visit www.foumamifranchise.com
name: Fóumami

about: Cake pops, Cupcakes, Chocolate Dipped Pretzels,Chocolate Covered Strawberries, etc. From birthdays to bridal parties to weddings we've got you covered.
description:
From birthdays to bridal showers to baby showers and weddings. Gender reveal parties. Bachelor and Bachelorette parties. Halloween. Christmas. The lost goes on and on and we've got you covered. 

Cake pops are the latest trend to hit the cake industry. Never heard of them? They're the perfect mix of cake meets lollipop. What is a classic cake pop? Simply put, classic cake pops are crumbled up cake mixed with just enough icing to shape them, then dipped in a delicious coating of smooth chocolate. With classic cake pops you get the best of both worlds. 

Then there is our delightful and inviting revamped version of the classic cake pop minus the icing. The inside is pure delectable cake. It is also dipped into silky smooth milk chocolate and decorated to perfection. Our cake pops are guaranteed to satisfy your sweet tooth.

Cake pops are the perfect alternative to a traditional cake for your special occasion. Each cake pop is hand crafted and made to order. All of our cake pops and cupcakes can be ordered in a variety of flavors. We have the traditional vanilla and chocolate. Elegant red velvet. The list goes on. 

We also offer chocolate dipped pretzels, chocolate covered strawberries, alcohol infused chocolate covered strawberries (must be 21 to order) and an array of bite sized desserts. For our full menu please click the "menu" tab. 

Contact us today here on LinkedIn or email us at 2sweetorders@gmail.com - Stay Sweet!
name: Two Sweet Mama's

description:
sweetgreen is a destination for simple, seasonal, healthy food. We believe the choices we make every day about what we eat, where it comes from, and how it's made have a lasting impact on our communities. From the seed to the store, we're involved in every step of the supply chain, working with partners and farmers we know and trust. We make our food from scratch in each sweetgreen every day, using whole produce delivered that morning.

As sweetgreen grows, we're dedicated to working with the right people. We've built a family of 1,500 hardworking individuals who care about developing future leaders and live our core values daily. We meet farmers before we meet landlords. We turn our new neighbors into friends. We're building a brand that connects to local neighborhoods and leaves communities better off than we found them. 

Our vision is to change the way people live their lives, starting with how they think about food. We've worked hard to build a company with passion and purpose - and we're just getting started.
name: sweetgreen

about: Our goal is to provide you with the best bagels.
description:
At Bagelville, you can find a huge range of bagels and other delicious items to enjoy for breakfast, lunch or a midday snack. We offer bagels in more than 20 different varieties including plain, sesame, multigrain, onion, garlic, vegetable, marble rye, chocolate chip, wild berry, honey grain, and many more! Whether you are looking for a simple bagel with cream cheese to get your day started, or want to kick it up a notch with one of our bagel pizzas for lunch, you can find a tasty item to match your mood and hunger level. We also make it easy for you to get what you want, when you want it, with our online ordering process. Select your favorite house bagel sandwich, order it in advance, and know it will be waiting for you on your lunch break or once you get off work.

In addition to bagels, you can also find a menu of soups, salads, and our homemade New England clam chowder. Not to mention we also have a large selection of specialty beverages and coffees including white chocolate mocha, vanilla chai tea, frozen Oreo cookie coffee, and many others. With three convenient locations you can easily stop in on your way to work, or on your way home to get a fresh delicious meal.

Visit our website for online take-out ordering at our Arlington & West Roxbury Locations.

Our fresh tossed salads like the Caesar, Greek, and Caprese are sure to fulfill your lunchtime cravings. Or, let us help you create a customized salad from a wide variety of fresh ingredients on our menu like crisp romaine lettuce, organic baby spinach, roasted eggplant, Kalamata olives, and more. 

Better yet, let us come to you! We offer catering for meetings and special events, both large and small. You can count on us to provide you with quality, fresh foods, prompt and friendly service, and a wide variety of Italian options for your daily and advance catering needs. Last minute lunch meeting? Try our easy bag lunches that are the perfect solution for meetings, conferences, and company outings.

Here at Pavia – Italian Cuisine & Catering, we strive to provide you with superior food, healthy and generous portions, and great value; all presented to you with elegance and expertise. At Pizzeria Rico, we specialize in hand-rolled and hand-prepped pizza and meatballs. Our menu includes everything from fine dinners, gourmet pizzas, salads, sandwiches, calzones, and more. One of our most popular dishes is the Chicken Parmigiana, but you can also never go wrong with our Bianco Supreme Pizza. 

We also offers catering services for evening functions and events. Located here at the heart of Boston’s Downtown Crossing neighborhood, we pride ourselves on our commitment to providing timely service in a pleasant, customer-focused atmosphere.

description:
sweetgreen is a destination for simple, seasonal, healthy food. We believe the choices we make every day about what we eat, where it comes from, and how it's made have a lasting impact on our communities. From the seed to the store, we're involved in every step of the supply chain, working with partners and farmers we know and trust. We make our food from scratch in each sweetgreen every day, using whole produce delivered that morning.

As sweetgreen grows, we're dedicated to working with the right people. We've built a family of 1,500 hardworking individuals who care about developing future leaders and live our core values daily. We meet farmers before we meet landlords. We turn our new neighbors into friends. We're building a brand that connects to local neighborhoods and leaves communities better off than we found them. 

Our vision is to change the way people live their lives, starting with how they think about food. We've worked hard to build a company with passion and purpose - and we're just getting started.
name: sweetgreen

about: Leave the cooking to us . . .
description:
The Dish offers homemade soups, salads, dinners and cupcakes prepared fresh for you with only the finest ingredients. We pride ourselves by using local, farm stand produce whenever possible. Our dinners are prepared with grade A meats and our cupcakes are made from scratch with imported cocoa, cinnamon, vanilla, butter and other pure elements.

We provide busy families and individuals with a weekly Dish menu that can be ordered online and delivered directly to you. As our customer, you will receive a weekly email highlighting the following weeks Dish menu. Orders are placed by Sunday evening for Wednesday delivery or pick-up. Delivery is complimentary in Medfield for orders of $25 or more. Pick up is available in Medfield for orders outside of Medfield.

Our scrumptious cupcakes are original recipes made from scratch. Add a half dozen of our flavor of the week cupcakes to any food order or special order cupcakes from a variety of flavors anytime (2 dozen minimum per flavor applies).

Hosting a dinner or function? We can provide food for parties of 50 or less (15 person minimum applies).
name: The Dish Medfield

about: Premium quality Ice Cream shop in Quincy Market located at Faneuil Hall Marketplace.
description:
Sprinkles Ice Cream located on the west end of Quincy market has been serving up their locally made farm fresh ice cream for over 35 years. This location was once home to Steve's Ice Cream, a Boston landmark. Steve's stopped making ice cream so the owners, two Boston business women revamped the shop into a trendy place offering all of the classics you would expect to find in this historic location. We offer something for everyone....17 flavors of ice-cream and more than 24 toppings to choose from. If you are calorie concerned, Sprinkles carries low fat soft serve ice cream and fresh fruit toppings. We also are famous for our custom made smash-ins where the customer designs their own concoction. In addition to Boston's finest ice-cream....our location is also a fudge shop with 10-12 different varieties of smooth and creamy fudge.

We cater parties and events and also offer our famous ice-cream cakes and pies.

Please stop by and enjoy the best ice-cream in Boston!
name: Sprinkles Ice Cream Boston

about: Avana Sushi 2 is Boston’s premier sushi restaurant. One taste of our many delectable rolls and you’ll be a fan for life!
description:
Avana Sushi 2 is Boston’s premier sushi restaurant. We specialize in serving fresh sushi at fantastic prices. 

Considered a cornerstone in the Boston community, we’re known for our excellent quality food, in addition to our exceptional service and friendly staff. With a choice of 3 items and a miso soup, our lunch specials can’t be beat. We offer over 40 raw and cooked rolls -- so whether it’s your first time trying sushi or you’re a sushi connoisseur, we have a roll that will delight your tastebuds!

With delicious dine-in, carryout, and delivery options, we know we’ll satisfy your sushi cravings. Visit us today!
name: Avana Sushi 2

description: At b.good, we serve food the way it was made for us by our Uncle Faris -- delicious, homemade, wholesome, and made with love. It's the kind of food that has roots. With kale and grain bowls, seasonal salads, hand-cut, oven-finished fries and sweet potato fries, seasonal veggies and locally raised, house-ground burgers, b.good offers something for everyone. about: From hearty omelets and fluffy pancakes to fresh salads and oversized deli-style sandwiches, something tasty awaits at Scali Deli Cafe in Boston.
description:
From hearty omelets, breakfast wraps and fluffy pancakes to homemade Italian specialties, fresh salads and oversized deli-style sandwiches, Scali Deli Cafe in Boston has something for everyone.

At Scali Deli Cafe in Boston, our philosophy is simple- Always fresh, only the best! Each meal begins with the finest, freshest ingredients, ordered daily. These ingredients are transformed by our chefs who artfully and expertly prepare each meal. Some local favorites include the Hash Bash, Local 222, Big Dig and, of course, the Godfather.

We invite you to stop in for an early morning breakfast on your way to the office or for a quick sandwich during your mid day break. Scali can also help you with all of your corporate catering needs from team meetings to conferences and events.

From fluffy pancakes to fresh salads, something tasty awaits at Scali!
name: Scali Cafe

about: The Boston Juice Company will be the premier spot for juice, smoothies and tonics in Boston. Currently, we are still looking for real estate. We will be sure to post updates!
description:
The mission of The Boston Juice Company is to offer freshly made vegetable juices, smoothies and tonics made from the best ingredients possible.  We strive to promote healthy living and emphasize the importance of health.

In conjunction with juices, smoothies and tonics, I want to offer hard-to-find (for me anyway) sundries.  Some things I find difficult to get in this area are:  good protein powder, low temp colostrum, herbs, mushrooms, dmso and other niche nutritional, supplemental and lifestyle necessities.

I want to include good snacks too, like kale chips, and chocolate.  

For juices, we'll offer to-order centrifugally made juice, or pre-made cold pressed juice that's bottled in Miron glass.

Smoothies and tonics will be made to order.

We will offer coffee.

www.williamcharleton.com

about: Coffee For A Cause!
description:
Welcome to Coffee For Fundraiser!

Is your organization tired of selling the same items over and over to raise money? Do you want to try something new? How about selling healthy instant gourmet coffee, tea and hot chocolate? Our nationally certified beverages include the Black Coffee, Latte, Mocha, Organic Green Tea, and Hot Chocolate. Our healthy gourmet beverages are infused with 100% Organic Ganoderma Lucidum. Ganoderma Lucidum has over 4,000 years of history, originally reserved for royalty. It is regarded by the Chinese as the “Miraculous King of Herbs” for its believed ability to help improve longevity through healing.

Google this miraculous herb and see for yourself.

Mission

The mission of Coffee For Fundraiser is to become the most powerful way to generate funds for your teams, groups, daycares centers, non-profit organizations and educational causes. With 70% of profit on your sales, we can help you to quickly and easily meet your financial goals. No goal is too big or too small.
name: Coffee For Fundraiser

about: LevelUp is the app that saves you time and money - Try order ahead to skip the line today at thousands of your favorite lunch, coffee, breakfast and dinner restaurants!
description:
LevelUp is building next-generation mobile experiences for over 200 brands nationwide: empowering businesses to engage customers, grow sales and build a long-term scalable mobile strategy. LevelUp’s platform offers a broad range of customized functionality: mobile rewards, payments, native online ordering, customer relationship management, a campaign creator with custom messaging, loyalty, gifting, and much more. You can find out a lot more on http://www.thelevelup.com.

The LevelUp omnichannel loyalty and CRM platform gathers data from all in-store and order-ahead transactions, enabling merchants to develop and implement targeted marketing campaigns to increase customer spend and frequency. 

LevelUp apps see over 35% usage on average - the highest in the industry and higher than adoption at Starbucks, Dunkin’ Donuts and Panera Bread. We have a potent combination of UI/UX best practices that make our restaurant apps easy for customers to download and use and a marketing playbook that sets your app up for quick and persistent growth.

LevelUp has two patents for integrated mobile payment at the point-of-sale, making us the only partner that can provide a seamless pay-at-the-counter experience. Our team of expert engineers build best-in-class mobile apps and ensure the LevelUp CRM, dashboard and marketing campaigns engine are at the cutting-edge of the industry. Our network engineers build partner integrations that enable restaurants to acquire new customers from distribution channels like Chase Pay, Facebook, Slack, Google, etc.
 
LevelUp’s strategic partnerships with Chase, Facebook, Google, and more give restaurants access to millions of customers in addition to those using their app. LevelUp is the only provider who is building a network that will enable you to take advantage of future shifts in the mobile landscape.

LevelUp is disrupting the world of online ordering and mobile payments on the consumer front. Our order ahead feature empowers people to skip the wait at thousands of their favorite restaurant locations nationwide. Our powerful order ahead network and in-store payment scanners allow customers to earn rewards at frequented restaurants, while saving time and money to win back their breakfast, lunch and dinner hours. LevelUp is truly a revolutionary solution to online ordering and mobile payments for restaurants.
name: LevelUp

about: Luciana's Italian Eatery is one of the Better ITALIAN Restaurants in the Boston area. If you like Italian food that is Authentic and from Italy, come here!
description: Capocollo (in the United States, cappicola or gabagoul; in Canada, capicollo or capicolla),[1] or coppa, is a traditional Italian pork cold cut (salume) made from the dry-cured muscle running from the neck to the 4th or 5th rib of the pork shoulder or neck. This cold cut is sometimes called coppa. The name capocollo comes from capo ("head") and collo ("neck") of a pig. The Italian word "capocollo'" is of Italian origin, but its precise etymology is unknown (in Latin caput means head and collum means head or head and neck). It is a whole muscle salume, dry cured and, typically, sliced very thin. It is similar to the more widely known cured ham or prosciutto, because they are both pork-derived cold-cuts that are used in similar dishes. However, coppa is not brined as ham typically is.
name: Luciana's Italian Eatery

description:
sweetgreen is a destination for simple, seasonal, healthy food. We believe the choices we make every day about what we eat, where it comes from, and how it's made have a lasting impact on our communities. From the seed to the store, we're involved in every step of the supply chain, working with partners and farmers we know and trust. We make our food from scratch in each sweetgreen every day, using whole produce delivered that morning.

As sweetgreen grows, we're dedicated to working with the right people. We've built a family of 1,500 hardworking individuals who care about developing future leaders and live our core values daily. We meet farmers before we meet landlords. We turn our new neighbors into friends. We're building a brand that connects to local neighborhoods and leaves communities better off than we found them. 

Our vision is to change the way people live their lives, starting with how they think about food. We've worked hard to build a company with passion and purpose - and we're just getting started.
name: sweetgreen
